summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case of United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, transmitting interview notes and FBI 302s (SDNY_GM_00332929 through SDNY_GM_00332942) and designating them as confidential under the case's protective order.

events.title: Disclosure of Interview Materials
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office transmits interview notes and FBI 302s (documents SDNY_GM_00332929 through SDNY_GM_00332942) to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel.

keyFacts: The document is a formal disclosure from the prosecution to the defense in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
The disclosure includes interview notes and FBI 302s, specifically numbered SDNY_GM_00332929 through SDNY_GM_00332942.
The contents of the letter and its enclosures are designated as 'Confidential' under the Protective Order in the case.
The letter is signed by the Acting U.S. Attorney, Audrey Strauss, indicating high-level involvement in the case management.
The document references an interview date of June 20, 2018 (06.20.2018), which is likely the date of one of the interviews documented in the enclosed materials.
